metric_defaults.$comment: All fields are strings for cross-compatibility with older importers.

target.description: A default target for a metric, potentially for a specific version of a global definition such as the source code of the project deifinition system or overridable quality control settings.

version_id.description: Version in which the default target was set.

commit_date.description: Moment when the default target was set.

direction.description: The direction in which the metric value should improve in order to become better. `-1` means a lower value is better, `1` means a higher value is better.

perfect_value.description: Target value where the metric cannot be improved further.

target_value.description: Target value where the metric is good when the value is equal or better than this target.

low_target_value.description: Target value where the metric is not good when it is worse than the target value, but better than this low target, and thus not yet critical.

scale.description:
Scale of the measured object.

- count: The measurement happens by counting items.
- percentage: The measurement leads to a fraction of items compared to its total.
- version_number: The measurement provides a software version.
